title: Understanding the Prodromal Phase
text: The prodromal phase is the initial stage of schizophrenia where symptoms start to appear but are not yet fully developed. It is often characterized by subtle changes in behavior and thinking.

title: Identifying Symptoms in the Prodromal Phase
text: During the prodromal phase, individuals may experience a reduction in the intensity of symptoms, leading to a period of relative calm and improved clarity of thought.

hintAnswer: a quieting of the symptoms, a diminishing of the active symptoms or “clearing,” and more clarity of thought
title: Characteristics of the Prodromal Phase
text: What are the key characteristics of the prodromal phase in schizophrenia?
choices: the disease is most visible and clients exhibit both the positive and negative symptoms of psychosis
a quieting of the symptoms, a diminishing of the active symptoms or “clearing,” and more clarity of thought
ongoing assessment and management of active symptoms and how they manifest and impair daily functioning
